snippet: A study by the Naandi Foundation found that in the poorest parts of India, about 42 percent of children under age 5 do not get enough to eat, which Prime Minister Manmohan Singh called “a matter of national shame.”
abstract: Study by the Naandi Foundation finds that 42 percent of all Indian children under age 5 suffer from malnutrition.
lead_paragraph: A study by the Naandi Foundation found that in the poorest parts of India, about 42 percent of children under age 5 do not get enough to eat, which Prime Minister Manmohan Singh called “a matter of national shame.”

headline.seo: Malnutrition in India Is Widespread, Report Finds
headline.main: Malnutrition Widespread in Indian Children, Report Finds
headline.print_headline: Malnutrition Widespread in Indian Children, Report Finds
